inference:
$\angle PAS = \frac{1}{2} \cdot 58^\circ = 29^\circ$ because the measure of an inscribed angle is half the measure of its intercepted arc.  Similarly, $\angle PBT = \frac{1}{2} \cdot 37^\circ = 18.5^\circ$.  Since $PA$ and $PB$ are tangent to the semicircles, $\angle PAR = \angle PBR = 90^\circ$.  Therefore,
\[\angle APB = 360^\circ - \angle PAR - \angle PBR - \angle PAS - \angle PBT = 360^\circ - 90^\circ - 90^\circ - 29^\circ - 18.5^\circ = \boxed{132.5^\circ}.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{132.5^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.
